info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Flathead County through 345 PM MDT... At 313 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whitefish, or 14 miles north of Evergreen, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Whitefish, Columbia Falls and La Salle. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 128 and 139. Highway 93 N between mile markers 118 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
